title: Legal Theory Colloquium
description:
Legal Theory Colloquium (21556). 1 or 2 units. Credit/fail if taken for 1 unit; graded if taken for 2 units. Every semester at Yale Law School, leading scholars from all over the world present work to members of the faculty at the Yale Legal Theory Workshop. This semester's speakers will be announced later in the summer and fall. Students in this seminar will attend the Workshop, having read and discussed in advance the speakers’ papers. The Workshop meets seven times over the course of the semester, on Thursdays, from 4:15 – 6:00 p.m. The seminar will meet on the Wednesday evening before the Workshop, except for January 17, from 6:10-8:00. No exam. Students taking the class for 2 credits will write three reaction papers over the course of the semester or one longer paper at the semester’s end. Enrollment limited; permission of the instructor required. J. Rubenfeld.

Course Selection: In addition to list this course among permission-of-instructor selections, students seeking admission should submit a statement of interest by 4:30 p.m. on December 6.

Schedule: The Legal Theory Workshop Seminar will meet on the dates to be announced later in the summer or early in the fall. Attendance at both the seminar and the workshop is required.
